content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word.

content.question: The class could feel the vibrant percussions of the drum corps rehearsing downstairs.
Ashley was reluctant to admit it, but doing all the required reading for an assignment was an efficacious way to prepare for the test.
The losing team seemed stoic in the face of defeat.
Army training inculcates soldiers with values of teamwork and discipline.
The painter’s stellar representations of light in different seasons and at different times of day impressed even the normally jaded critics.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word.

content.question: Gymnasts perform prodigious acts of flexibility and strength.
Ever since he received the telescope for his birthday, Travis has been preoccupied with stellar occurrences.
Keri decorated her room with the vibrant colors that streaked the sky at sunset.
The efficacy of many prescription drugs depends on the patient’s proper usage.
Dani’s refusal to think, read, or write will cause her mind to atrophy.

content.section_header: Choose the best way to complete each sentence or answer each question

content.question: You are most likely to receive an emolument when you
Stanley prepared for the marathon with a daily workout regimen. A regimen is
Because of his refusal to bend any rule, Coach Brown was known to be a martinet. He is most likely
While everyone else was hysterical, Lance, always the stoic, seemed
If a painting is described as an icon, it is likely to be

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: While an inestimable number of people love acting and are passionate about it, relatively few are brave enough to pursue acting in films and television as a career. This is because even the most zealous and dedicated actors can find themselves out of work for long periods of time. They can move to Hollywood, hire an agent, and go to several auditions a day, even get a few roles here and there in commercials, and still not be able to get work steadily enough to pay their rent.

Most actors are realistic about their careers. They know only a few actors become successful, and very few become icons within the industry. They don’t expect to become movie stars. They also know that even the stars with prodigious numbers of awards can go through times when they are unable to find work. It is not an easy industry to be successful in for a lifetime. One lackluster performance onscreen, or one bad review, can seriously impact an actor’s reputation.

content.question: The phrase “an inestimable number” (line 1) most nearly means
The meaning of zealous (line 4) is
The word icons (line 11) most nearly means
In line 12, prodigious means
The word lackluster (line 15) most nearly means
